name: angular-2-typeScript-snippets
readme:
# Angular 2 TypeScript Snippets for Atom This extension for Atom adds snippets for Angular 2 for TypeScript and HTML. ## Usage Type part of a snippet, press `enter`, and the snippet unfolds. ### TypeScript Snippets |snippet|explanation| |-------|-----------| |[ng2-bootstrap](#ng2-bootstrap) |bootstrap a module| |[ng2-module](#ng2-module) |create a module| |[ng2-component](#ng2-component) |create a component| |[ng2-input](#ng2-input) |create an input property| |[ng2-output](#ng2-output) |create an output event| |[ng2-directive](#ng2-directive) |create a directive| |[ng2-pipe](#ng2-pipe) |create a pipe| |[ng2-routes](#ng2-routes) |setup routes| |[ng2-route-path](#ng2-route-path) |configure single| |[ng2-service](#ng2-service) |create a service| |[ng2-subscribe](#ng2-subscribe) |subscribe to an observable| |[ng2-rx-map](#ng2-rx-map) |import map-operator | ### HTML Snippets |snippet | |---------------------------------| |[ng2-ngClass](#ng2-ngclass) | |[ng2-ngFor](#ng2-ngfor) | |[ng2-ngIf](#ng2-ngif) | |[ng2-ngModel](#ng2-ngmodel) | |[ng2-property](#ng2-property) | |[ng2-event](#ng2-event) | |[ng2-routerLink](#ng2-routerlink)| |[ng2-ngStyle](#ng2-ngstyle) | |[ng2-ngSwitch](#ng2-ngswitch) | Alternatively, press `Ctrl`+`Space` (Windows, Linux) or `Cmd`+`Space` (OSX) to activate snippets from within the editor. ## Known Issues It seems that you need to have a `tsconfig.json` to get the TypeScript snippets to work. ## Snippets in Detail No one wants to buy a pig in a poke. The following section will show you what the provided snippets actually do for you. ### ng2-bootstrap `ng2-bootstrap` allows you to start your root module to get your app up and running. It also prepares `enableProdMode()` for you. ```ts import { platformBrowserDynamic } from '@angular/platform-browser-dynamic'; import { enableProdMode } from '@angular/core'; import { } from './.module'; //enableProdMode(); //Uncomment for production platformBrowserDynamic().bootstrapModule(); ``` ### ng2-module `ng2-module` provides a skeleton for an Angular 2 module. ```ts import { NgModule } from '@angular/core'; @NgModule({ imports: [], declarations: [, ], providers: [] }) export class { } ``` ### ng2-component `ng2-component` provides a skeleton for an Angular 2 Component. It saves you time typing the mandatory Decorator properties. ```ts import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: '', templateUrl: '.component.html', }) export class Component implements OnInit { constructor() { } ngOnInit() {} } ``` ### ng2-input `ng2-input` is a handy snippet to add an input property to a component class. ```ts @Input() : ; ``` ### ng2-output `ng2-output`generates a output event in a component class. ```ts @Output() : EventEmitter = new EventEmitter(); ``` ### ng2-import `ng2-import` gives you a shorthand writing import-statements. ```ts import {} from ''; ``` ### ng2-directive `ng2-directive` provides a skeleton for an Angular 2 Attribute or Structural Directive. ```ts import { Directive, Input } from '@angular/core'; @Directive({ selector: '[]' }) export class [DirectiveName]Directive { } ``` ### ng2-pipe `ng2-pipe` provides a skeleton for an Angular 2 Pipe. ```ts import { Pipe, PipeTransform } from '@angular/core'; @Pipe({ name: '' }) export class Pipe implements PipeTransform { transform(value: , args: any[]) : { return ; } } ``` ### ng2-routes `ng2-routes` creates the `@Routes` decorator with a single route in it. ```ts import { RouterModule, Routes } from '@angular/router'; const app_routes: Routes = [ { path: '', component: }, { path: '**', pathMatch: 'full', redirectTo: '' } ]; export const app_routing = RouterModule.forRoot(app_routes); ``` ### ng2-route-path `ng2-route-path` adds a single route to `@Routes`. **Use** this snippet inside the `@Routes` decorator. ```ts { path: '/', component: } ``` ### ng2-service `ng2-service` provides a skeleton for an Angular 2 Service. ```ts import { Injectable } from '@angular/core'; @Injectable() export class Service { constructor() { } } ``` ### ng2-subscribe `ng2-subscribe` gives you a shorthand to call a service function, that returns a observable. The `subscribe` method is also created for you. So you can assign the response quickly. ```ts this.. .subscribe( => this. = }); ``` ### ng2-rx-map `ng2-rx-map` simply creates the import statement to reference the map operator of RxJs. ```ts import 'rxjs/add/operator/map'; ``` ### ng2-ngClass This snippet inserts the `ngClass` directive. ```html
``` ### ng2-ngFor This snippet inserts the `ngFor` directive. ```html
``` ### ng2-ngIf This snippet inserts the `ngIf` directive. ```html
``` ### ng2-ngModel This snippet inserts the `ngModel` directive. ```html
``` ### ng2-property This snippet inserts the skeleton for a property binding directive. ```html
``` ### ng2-event This snippet inserts the skeleton for a event binding directive. ```html
``` ### ng2-routerLink This snippet inserts the `routerLink` directive. ```html ``` ### ng2-ngStyle This snippet inserts the `ngStyle` directive. ```html
``` ### ng2-ngSwitch This snippet inserts the `ngSwitch` directive. ```html
output
output2
```
